intro: Chaetaria coarctata, commonly known as the narrowleaf chaetaria, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a compact cluster. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest to botanists studying biodiversity in the region.
